Package chess88pckg

Class Chess

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess88pckg.Chess
  • public class Chess
extends java.lang.Object
    Chess is the main class that runs the entire program. The class creates a chess board using a two dimensional array of Pieces objects. The class also houses the methods for printing the board, updating the board, recognizing a check, recognizing a checkmate, getting the available moves for all remaining pieces on the board.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main method for the program. This method will create the chessboard and all of the pieces. It will then populate the board with the pieces and update all of the pieces to have the correct information based on thier location. The method will also continually take inputs for moving pieces and commit the moves after determining they are legal moves. Once a checkmate, resignation, or draw has been reached the method finishes and the program terminates.

        Parameters:
        args - arguments passed in via the command line

      • printBoard

        public static void printBoard​(Pieces[][] board)
        Takes the current status of the chess board and prints it out.

        Parameters:
        board - the chess board

      • checkMoves

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> checkMoves​(Pieces piece,
                                                               Pieces[][] board)
        Takes a specific piece and the chess board and the iterates through all of that pieces possible moves based on what type of move it is. If a move is determined to be one that the piece can make the string location of the move is added to that piece's available moves which is an ArrayList of strings. The string location is based on the chess board as opposed to the array coordinates. For example, the location of the bottom left of the board would be "a1" instead of (0, 0). The method then returns that pieces available moveset.

        Parameters:
        piece - the piece the needs its moveset checked
        board - the chess board
        Returns:
        the ArrayList of strings that contains all of the available moves for the inputted piece

      • getRow

        public static int getRow​(java.lang.String location)
        Takes a string location and returns the row coordinate for Pieces[][] board.

        Parameters:
        location - the string representation of a piece's location
        Returns:
        the integer corresponding to the row of the string location

      • getCol

        public static int getCol​(java.lang.String location)
        Takes a string location and returns the column coordinate for Pieces[][] board.

        Parameters:
        location - the string representation of a piece's location
        Returns:
        the integer corresponding to the column of the string location

      • cordToString

        public static java.lang.String cordToString​(int row,
                                            int col)
        Takes the row and column coordinates corresponding to a location on the chessboard and converts it into the string representation of the coordinates. For example, the bottom left of the board is the coordinates (0, 0). Passing 0 in for row and 0 in for column would return the string "a1".

        Parameters:
        row - the integer corresponding to the row of a board location
        col - the integer corresponding to the column of a board location
        Returns:
        the corresponding string of the inputted row and column

      • updateBoard

        public static void updateBoard​(Pieces[][] board)
        Takes the chess board and updates all of the pieces with the correct information. In essence the method updates each piece to have the accurate available moves based on the current position of all pieces on the board.

        Parameters:
        board - the chess board

      • checkValid

        public static boolean checkValid​(Pieces[][] board)
        Takes the chess board and determines if a particular move is valid. If the most recent move now allows an opposing piece to attack your king the method returns false, indicating that the proposed move is not valid.

        Parameters:
        board - the chess board
        Returns:
        true if the proposed move is valid; false otherwise.

      • inCheck

        public static void inCheck​(Pieces[][] board)
        Determines based on the current position of the pieces if the current color's king is in check. In essence the method checks all opposing pieces' available moves for the current color's king's location. If the king is in check it prints out check and returns.

        Parameters:
        board - the chess board

      • inCheckmate

        public static boolean inCheckmate​(Pieces[][] board)
        Determines based on the current position of the pieces if the current color's king is in checkmate. In essence the method finds if the current color has any possible moves that would allow its king to no longer be in any opposing pieces' available moves.

        Parameters:
        board - the chess board
        Returns:
        true if the current color has an available move; false otherwise.
